metadata.title: CVE-2021-33500 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: PuTTY before 0.75 on Windows allows remote servers to cause a denial ofservice (Windows GUI hang) by telling the PuTTY window to change its titlerepeatedly at high speed, which results in many SetWindowTextA orSetWindowTextW calls. NOTE: the same attack methodology may affect someOS-level GUIs on Linux or other platforms for similar reasons.

criterions.comment: putty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
